fullText: Blanchett brings her fierce intelligence and commanding stage presence to bear on the role of Anna Petrovna, a wealthy widow whose romantic entanglements drive the plot of this leisurely paced but ultimately rewarding drama.
dtliExcerpt: Blanchett brings her fierce intelligence and commanding stage presence to bear on the role of Anna Petrovna, a wealthy widow whose romantic entanglements drive the plot of this leisurely paced but ultimately rewarding drama.
bwwExcerpt: Cate Blanchett and Richard Roxburgh lead the Sydney Theater Company in a sparkling production of 'The Present,' Andrew Upton's free-form treatment of Anton Chekhov's 'Platonov.' The original play, an early effort written when the playwright was 21, is quite the shaggy dog - rambling, unfocused and stuffed with gratuitous characters. But the spirit of Chekhovian farce shines bright, and the ensemble work of this Aussie company is just grand.
